content.raw:
Thanks for getting the docker image of ignition gazebo ready and posted \(Issue 107 looks resolved now\).  One additional thing we could really use would be a boilerplate vehicle docker image, preferably one that is able to demonstrate basic functionality of each vehicle type such as:

1. Moving in a straight line and turning \(on X1, X2\), taking off, and going forward \(X3, X4\)
2. Communicating with the base station \(proven ability to send artifact packets to the ground station and receive an acknowledgement

Now that vehicle docker images are not necessarily built on top of the subt catkin workspace, it is a little unclear to us what we need in the baseline vehicle docker image.  We know we need to use the subt comms interface, and the only way we know how to do that right now is to build our ros packages in the same catkin workspace as subt.
